business.headline: Oracle's Larry Ellison surpasses Elon Musk to become world's richest personEllison's net worth jumped by an unprecedented $101 billion in a single day after Oracle Corp. delivered blowout quarterly results, sparking a record surge in its stock.

From 20s to retirement: How bonds strengthen your financesBonds don't grab headlines like stocks, but they quietly strengthen your finances across life stages. From building discipline in your 20s to ensuring stability in retirement, they remain a steady anchor for wealth creation. Here's how they work for you.
Document shows India resisting complete crypto regulation: ReportWhile some countries like Japan and Australia are developing frameworks to regulate digital assets carefully, India remains cautious.

Sensex, Nifty extend gains on US trade deal hopes and Fed rate cut buzzThe NSE Nifty 50 climbed 104.50 points to close at 24,973.10, while the BSE Sensex added 323.83 points, ending at 81,425.15. The Nifty has now gained for six straight sessions, with the Sensex rising in five of the last six trading days.

Festive season stocks that you should add to your portfolioWith people ready to spend on home appliances, beauty products, lifestyle goods, and automobiles, investors are now looking for stocks that could benefit from this surge in demand.

Is your credit score falling? Here's how to fix itHas your credit score recently taken a hit? You're not alone. Many people discover a drop only when applying for a loan or credit card. The good news is, most reasons are easy to fix with a few smart steps.

Fitch raises India's growth forecast to 6.9% for FY26 on strong Q2 performanceThe revision comes after India's real GDP grew by 7.8% in the April–to-June quarter, surpassing expectations and marking an acceleration from the 7.4% growth seen in the previous three months.

Delhi High Court asks Priya Kapur to list Sunjay Kapur's assetsThe legal dispute over the estate of the late businessman Sanjay Kapoor has reached the Delhi High Court. A suit has been filed by Karishma Kapoor's two children, who claim they are entitled to their father's personal assets as legal heirs. The High Court has registered the suit and will hear the matter on the 9th of October to decide on an interim stay. The children contend they have been informed they are not beneficiaries under Sanjay Kapoor's will, which they are now questioning and allege has been forged. In response, Priya Kapoor's counsel has told the court that the children "have already been given 1900 crore worth of assets six days before the suit was even filed." The Delhi High Court has directed Priya Kapoor to file a list of all movable and immovable assets of Sanjay Kapoor known to her.

This crypto exchange eyes $3 billion IPO with Nasdaq backingThe company, backed by the Winklevoss twins, plans to sell 16.67 million shares at a price between $24 and $26 each, up from its previous range of $17 to $19 per share.

Why affordable housing demand is slowing down in IndiaAffordable housing was once the backbone of India's housing dream, offering budget-friendly options to urban families. But today, demand in this segment is slipping, as buyers increasingly feel these homes don't match their needs.

Can Karisma Kapoor's children get a part of Sunjay Kapur's Rs 30,000 crore empire?The lawsuit from Karisma Kapoor's children accuses their stepmother Priya Sachdeva of withholding critical information and details about Sunjay Kapur's will. The hearing for this case is scheduled for today, September 10, 2025.

Court asks Priya Kapur to list Sunjay Kapur's assets after lawsuitDelhi High Court has asked Priya Sachdev Kapur to submit a detailed list of all movable and immovable assets belonging to the late Sunjay Kapur.

entertainment.headline: Sunita Ahuja recalls Govinda flirted with co-stars: Only Sonali Bendre was sparedSunita Ahuja appeared as a guest judge on 'Pati Patni Aur Panga' and shared fun insights about her actor-husband Govinda. She revealed Govinda flirted with many co-actors but never with Sonali Bendre, adding a nostalgic touch to the show.

Actor Mohini says she was forced to do intimate scene in Kanmani despite discomfortActor Mohini revealed she was forced to perform intimate scenes in 'Kanmani' without her consent. She admitted that she was pressureised to shoot a swimsuit scene despite her discomfort.

My Youth review: Song Joong-ki returns with slow burn K-drama not for everyoneRelease Date:Fri Sep 05, 2025'My Youth' is a slow-burn romance K-drama starring Song Joong-ki and Chun Woo-hee. The series blends nostalgia with intimate storytelling, offering a soothing watch for romance fans.

Modern Family star Eric Stonestreet marries his longtime partner Lindsay SchweitzerEric Stonestreet, famed for his role in 'Modern Family', is married to his long-time girlfriend Lindsay Schweitzer in an intimate ceremony at their Kansas City home. The couple shared joyous moments on social media.

Gauri Pradhan reunites with ex-actor friend, now industry head at Google IndiaGauri Pradhan recently met her long-time friend Mayoori Kango, now a Google India executive. Their reunion highlights Mayoori's journey from Bollywood to a successful corporate career, demonstrating significant transitions in her professional life.

Rajinikanth congratulates Sivakarthikeyan for Madharaasi: Excellent action, loved itTamil actor Sivakarthikeyan, whose latest film 'Madhaarasi' is currently running in theatres, shared the special message he got from his idol Rajinikanth on X.

Director Anuparna Roy stands by Palestine remarks: Doesn't make me less IndianAnuparna Roy's debut film 'Songs of Forgotten Trees' won Best Director at the Venice Film Festival, marking a proud moment for Indian cinema. The young filmmaker shared her challenging journey and heartfelt gratitude towards the support from industry stalwarts like Anurag Kashyap and fellow Bollywood colleagues.

Maheep, Bhavana say no to Bijuria dance, KJo turns to Varun-Janhvi for tipsFilmmaker Karan Johar shared a video of Maheep Kapoor and Bhavana Pandey declining to dance to 'Bijuria'. The request was made in an Instagram post termed 'reluctant nepo moms'. The post also referenced Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor for potential dance lessons.

Kunickaa Sadanand's son Ayaan says her relationship with Kumar Sanu was very toxicActor Ayaan Lall opened up about his mother Kunickaa Sadanand's relationship with singer Kumar Sanu. He clarified the timeline and describes the relationship as toxic, shedding light on her post-divorce life.

Demon Slayer Infinity Castle: A beginner's guide to the world-class anime hitWith 'Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle' releasing soon, fans in India can catch up by watching just a few key episodes instead of the entire series. The film has already set records with advance bookings and early morning screenings, promising an exciting experience for anime lovers.

Is Shehbaz Badesha's entry into Bigg Boss 19 a low-key TV nepotism moment?Shehbaz Badesha, brother of actor Shehnaaz Gill, is the first wild card contestant of 'Bigg Boss 19'. He made a brief appearance in the reality show's 13th season to support his sister. But does he deserve to be in this season?

After Aishwarya, Abhishek Bachchan files plea on misuse of personality rightsAfter Aishwarya Rai, Abhishek Bachchan moved Delhi Court over personal rights protection.  He wants a ban on the unauthorised use of his images, name, voice, and performances.

Kunickaa gets support from 'doodhwala community', actor's son shares proofBigg Boss 19's Kunickaa Sadanand faced criticism inside the house but received unexpected support from the local 'doodhwala community.' Her son Ayaan Lall showcased this backing by sharing a video of milkmen rallying behind her.

Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle and the rise of anime films in IndiaDemon Slayer: Infinity Castle is breaking box office records with over Rs 30 crore in advance bookings. This success signals a major shift as anime moves from niche to mainstream in India.

Varun Tej-Lavanya Tripathi welcome baby boy, Chiranjeevi congratulates new parentsSouth actor couple Varun Tej and Lavanya Tripathi have announced the arrival of their first child, a baby boy. They announced pregnancy in May 2025.

The Paper review: Not The Office, but awkwardly charming in its own wayRelease Date:Fri Sep 05, 2025The Paper series review: 'The Paper', a new comedy series streaming on Peacock and JioHotstar, brings a newsroom twist to the awkward humour fans loved in 'The Office'. Set in a struggling paper company in Toledo, it offers a fresh yet relatable take on office politics and journalism struggles in 2025.

Kantara Chapter 1's Kerala release in trouble over profit-sharing disputeKerala Film Exhibitors Union has halted the screening of Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1'. There's a rising dispute over profit sharing with Prithviraj Sukumaran, who is distributing the film in the state.

Viral: Janhvi Kapoor dances to Bijuria with Ishaan Khatter and Vishal JethwaActors Janhvi Kapoor, Ishaan Khatter, and Vishal Jethwa's dance to the 'Bijuria' song is going viral. In less than 24 hours, the video has garnered more than 17 million views. The song is from the upcoming film 'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari'.

Kiss trailer: Kavin, Preethi Asrani headline quirky romance comedy with a twistThe trailer of the upcoming Tamil film 'Kiss', featuring Kavin and Preethi Asrani, was recently released, and it seems to be much more than just a simple rom-com. The film will release in theatres on September 19.

general news.headline: Violation of sovereignty: PM calls Qatar Emir, condemns Israeli strikes on DohaQatar is a key US ally and a mediator in the Gaza peace talks. The attack took place at a time when several Hamas leaders were in Doha to participate in the US-backed ceasefire talks.

Nepal's Gen Z picks Chief Justice Sushila Karki as interim leaderFormer Chief Justice Sushila Karki has emerged as Gen Z's top choice for Nepal's head of interim government after over 5,000 young people backed her during a nationwide virtual meeting.

We can help you address racism: India schools Switzerland over minority remarkKshitij Tyagi's remarks came a day after Switzerland called on India to "take effective measures to protect the minorities and uphold the rights to the freedom of expression and the freedom of the media."

Nasa says Perseverance Rover discovered potential signs of life on Mars in 2024Scientists say the sample contains potential biosignatures, substances or structures that might have a biological origin but require rigorous testing before any claims about life on Mars can be made.

iPhone 17 is here and its time to discuss the great smartphone scamWhether you're Team Apple or Team Android, you're all suckers in this grand smartphone scam. These devices promise connection but deliver isolation: one notification at a time. So next time you pull out your precious gadget, remember: it's not a status symbol, it's a shiny leash.

India vs UAE LIVE: India hammer UAE to complete record-breaking winIndia (IND) vs United Arab Emirates (UAE) live cricket score and updates: Abhishek Sharma has been dismissed for a blazing 30, but India are racing towards the 58-run chase in some fancy manner after the Indian bowlers had wrapped up the UAE innings in just 13.1 overs. Kuldeep Yadav took four wickets while Shivam Dube chipped in with three wickets as the UAE were bowled out for just 57 in Dubai.

Donald Trump's return gift to Qatar: $400 million betrayalA White House official said that the US was informed well in advance of Israel's strike in Qatar to target Hamas leaders. The fact the strikes occurred in Qatar, a close ally of the US that has worked to cultivate Trump, only contributed to the sense of betrayal.

Return of the Relic: How Prophet's stolen hair returned to Hazratbal mysteriouslyIn 1963, Kashmir's most sacred relic vanished, sparking mass unrest, political blame, and enduring suspicion. Its mysterious return restored faith for some but left a haunting question: was it truly the same?

This is how friends negotiate: US singer on Trump, PM Modi's posts on trade talksEarlier today, Trump called PM Modi his "very good friend", while the Prime Minister framed the talks as a way to unlock the "limitless potential" of the India-US trade and strategic partnership.

Why Nepal legitimacy crisis begs shuffling beyond power chairsNepal's young, for whom corruption is no abstraction, have realised collective power and refuse to return to the margins. Yet, de-escalation is the immediate imperative

Nationwide voter roll revision SIR likely to begin by OctoberThe announcement for a nationwide Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of the electoral roll could come even before the Bihar Assembly election concludes, sources said.

The modern guide to battling relationship burnout (without breaking up)If your relationship feels less like a partnership and more like living with a roommate, it may be a sign that the spark has faded and burnout is setting in.

Log kya kahenge? How middle-class shame drives student suicides in IndiaMiddle-class shame turns exam failure, relationship taboos and family silence into life-threatening crises for Indian youth. In 2022, India recorded 1.7 lakh suicides. A third of them were in the 18–30 age band. On World Suicide Prevention Day, here's why we need to cut shame and "log kya kahenge" from our vocabulary if we want to save young lives.

Live: Intel agencies on alert, security tightened amid Nepal unrest, say sourcesFormer Chief Justice Sushila Karki emerged as Gen Z's top choice for Nepal's interim government amid ongoing political turmoil. The Gen Z-led protests in Nepal have left 1,033 people injured and the death toll has risen to 30. KP Sharma Oli resigned after demonstrators stormed government buildings and set fire to leaders' residences. Follow IndiaToday.in for live updates.

UPSC's top optionals: Why History, Pub Ad and Anthropology stay on topHistory, Public Administration and Anthropology remain UPSC's most popular optional subjects. Their syllabus overlap and scoring potential continue to attract aspirants despite challenges.

What India should make of China's post-SCO military spectacleIndian military planners believe that for New Delhi, the key lesson is that China's military grandstanding should not be mistaken for invulnerability

iPhone 17 launch at Steve Jobs Theatre was full of stars, brightest turned out to be latest Apple gadgetsLike every year, this time too at the Steve Jobs Theatre, the biggest tech launch of the year involved rushing from one demo area to another, selfies, and trying out the latest iPhones and other gadgets that Apple launched in its Awe Dropping event on September 9.

Who set Nepal on fire? Violence shocks Gen Z protesters themselvesWho set Nepal on fire? Nepal's Gen Z protesters said they aren't to blame for the arson and violent attacks on leaders. They claimed that they were, in fact, trying to prevent violence and pinned the blame for the arson on "political opportunists". This suggests that the protests in Nepal were hijacked, like last year's Bangladesh agitation.

Who's Nepal's Sushila Karki? Tough ex-jurist, nostalgic about BHUSushila Karki is likely to be Nepal's next Prime Minister. Karki, who was Nepal's first woman chief justice, studied at India's Banaras Hindu University (BHU). She is known for zero-tolerance on corruption, and was hit by an impeachment motion in 2017 over alleged judicial activism.

Look at neighbours, proud of our Constitution: Chief Justice Gavai cites Nepal turmoilChief Justice of India BR Gavai cited turmoil in Nepal and Bangladesh turmoils to underline the strength of the Indian Constitution.

Indian tourist in Nepal cries for help: Mob torched hotel, chased me with sticksAn Indian woman, who travelled to Nepal for a volleyball tournament, described her harrowing experience in Pokhara, where her hotel was set on fire, and she barely managed to escape.
Will Nepal's anarchy lead to the return of monarchy?Pro-monarchy chants heard during Nepal's Gen Z protests. Will democracy's crisis be an opportunity for the Shah dynasty?
Grumbling stomach 35,000 ft in the air? It's jet belly (here's a fix)While a jet belly is really just air pressure messing with your gut, but if you have existing stomach issues, it can get trickier.

sports.headline: Spirit of Cricket award for Suryakumar? India withdraw appeal vs UAE in Asia CupAsia Cup 2025: Suryakumar Yadav showed true sportsmanship by withdrawing an appeal against a UAE batter whose stumping came after a momentary distraction. India, meanwhile, were clinical with the ball, dismissing the hosts for just 57 in 13.1 overs.

Sanju Samson fans delighted as captain Suryakumar keeps his promiseAsia Cup 2025: Ending weeks-long suspense, India included Sanju Samson in the playing XI despite bringing Shubman Gill back to the fold. Samson's fans were thrilled as the team management backed him on the big stage.

Sanju Samson retains spot despite Shubman Gill's inclusion in Asia Cup openerStar wicketkeeper Sanju Samson retained his spot in India's playing XI for the Asia Cup T20 opener against hosts UAE in Dubai on Thursday, even with vice-captain Shubman Gill returning to the side.

From KKR to Team India: How Gautam Gambhir backs players when they themselves don'tGautam Gambhir's greatest strength as a coach lies beyond tactics — it's his unwavering faith in players. From Harshit Rana to Sanju Samson and Varun Chakravarthy, he backs them when they doubt themselves, turning belief into performance.

Asia Cup 2025 Tickets Online: India vs Pakistan match booking and price guideTickets for Asia Cup 2025 are now available for purchase online and at stadium box offices. Fans can choose from various pricing tiers and special packages ahead of the September tournament.

Jofra Archer rises to career-best ICC ODI rankings after South Africa heroicsJofra Archer's searing performance against South Africa has propelled him to a career-best No.3 in the ICC ODI Rankings, marking a milestone comeback as he eyes England's next assignment against New Zealand in October.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
